• Localisation: "Add new watch..." text in the Variables tab is not localised, always uses English
• Path Editor: Shift Path button is obscured when using certain IDE languages
• Preferences: Add a new "IDE Font" setting into General settings
• Preferences: Feather's Naming Rules page should mention all depend on rule 2017 being enabled
• Preferences: Object Editor's "Default Event Content" removes any blank lines when GM is next restarted
• Preferences: Object Editor's "Default Event Content" replaces tab characters with "\t" when you restart GM
• Preferences: Raw DPI value sometimes changes after being edited directly in text box
• Room Editor: "Select From Any Layer" switches itself off after one use
• Search & Replace: Does not change GML Visual function names if the function's node is open
• Search & Replace: Does not work correctly on GML Visual node values
• Sequence Editor: GM unstable when manually adding a keyframe to an Image Index track
• Start Page: Tour's '#' prompt overlaps with the text and has been cut off in some languages
• Start Page: Tour's "SKIP to Set up Wizard" is cut off in a number of languages
• Start Page: Tour's "Set Up Wizard" string is cut off for SP, IT, FR, BZ
• Startup: Setting the DPI override to a large percentage causes the DPI to be maxed out and stops the override notification message appearing
• Startup: Steam IDEs will prompt user to download standalone installers
• Syntax Errors: Dialog is not already populated with existing errors whenever opened manually
• Syntax Errors: Window no longer shows if Feather is changed from enabled to disabled in that IDE session
• Time Sources: GMLV actions do not have their manual tags, so F1 doesn't work as expected
• Workspaces: "Syntax Errors" window does not reopen via the Menu Bar button if Feather is enabled
• Workspaces: Editor windows all have a line of black pixels at their top edge in 500 Betas
Changes Since IDE 2022.6.0.23
Feather Fixes/Changes
<ul>
• Project Load: GM no longer goes unstable when opening projects containing Instance Variables which have no name when Feather is enabled [was thought to be in 2022.6.0 already, but is in now]
Rollback Multiplayer Fixes/Changes
<ul>
• Debugger: Rollback-enabled instances no longer list some of their variables as "unknown"
• Code Editor: rollback_define_input_frame_delay() now correctly shows its argument name as "delay" rather than "enabled"
Misc Important Changes To Be Aware Of

Beta IDE 147
Feather Fixes/Changes

Removed Some Legacy Platforms/Architectures
<ul>
• Some lesser-used or largely redundant versions of the targets have now been removed, so we can focus support on the current tools instead. These are:
• Android x86 architecture (x86_64 is still there, so you can still use 64bit emulators)

<li>UWP target has been removed entirely, as the Windows store has accepted native packages for a while and the GDK extension can be used to implement current versions of Microsoft’s social functionality
• Windows x86 (32bit support) architecture has been removed from Game Options, so now only 64bit executables are available
• Xbox One Legacy (XDK) target has been removed entirely, as GDK has been available for a while
Project Format Changes For Tile Layers In Rooms
<ul>

• We have introduced a new, much faster method for storing tile data in your rooms and passing this information into your builds - which fixes a long-time issue where rooms with lots of tile slots could see a pause on the line "Found Project Format 2" in their output log

• However, this new format is not compatible with older IDEs/runtimes and so accordingly we have introduced a new safeguard in this version, should you attempt to open a project in an older IDE again.
• On opening the project in any version newer than 2022.6 GameMaker will raise the project version automatically to be 1.6

• The next time a room containing a tile layer is edited in the newer IDE, this will potentially upgrade all the tile data and save it in a "TileCompressedData" variable in the room’s own .yyp file - at this point, this project cannot be loaded into previous IDEs as it won’t understand it. (The project would also lack all the tiles information if you used a current IDE but with a runtime from 2022.6 or older.)

• Please note if the room wouldn't benefit from the compression, GameMaker will continue to store the data in the old-style "TileSerialiseData" variable - this is the same format as before and previous IDEs can open it if you need to; however, you will need to follow the steps in our FAQ for opening “too new” projects in older IDEs
Additional Feather Functionality
<ul>
• Naming Rules now have a new value of "Unconstrained", which you can set to tell Feather to allow any naming convention when dealing with certain aspects of your code
Additional Extension Options Functionality
<ul>
• Added combobox gadget support into the extension options editor and also the ability to mark settings as hidden to the “user-facing” extension options
• Added support for native-language Android/iOS extensions to access your extension options values, as set in the IDE
Misc Important Changes To Be Aware Of
<ul>

• Building Projects: Sound assets with invalid or non-existent underlying files are still embedded in the game, should error instead [now you will be asked to fix problem sounds before the build will succeed - note that those sounds would not have worked correctly in-game in previous releases, and our only change here is that you were not told this]
Other Bugs Fixed
<ul>
• Asset Browser: Unable to delete multiple Tags at once in Quick Access
• Building Projects: Clean up "hobby subscription" code and remove associated splash screens from the runtimes
• Building Projects: Compiler hangs for a minute or more on "Found Project Format 2" on attached project
• Building Projects: Switch builds no longer contain the IDE version number in their metadata, can cause submission fails
• Building Projects: Texture pages are being re-written every run in 2022.6.0, causing long build times
• Building Projects: Ubuntu IDE cannot build Android YYC for projects with extensions
• Building Projects: [HTML5] Global-scope macros which call in-built variables will cause a build error
• Building Projects: [Mac IDE] Building archives for iOS and tvOS will not show Xcode Organiser on completion
• Building Projects: [Mac IDE] HTML5 and Android targets do not open Finder when the build has succeeded
• Building Projects: [Ubuntu IDE] Android, HTML5, and Ubuntu builds don't open the file browser to show the resulting package
• Building Projects: [Ubuntu IDE] Ubuntu builds fail when targeting the local machine
• Building Projects: [Ubuntu] Unable to build if targeting a 22.04 LTS machine, due to "Permission denied (publickey)"
• Building Projects: [Windows] Builds can fail if Windows is set to some language/region format styles, giving "startIndex cannot be larger than length of string" error
• Building Projects: [Xbox GDK] Add new Preference for whether to deploy the package after a Create Exe
• Building Projects: [YYC] Build fails when using parent constructor and new constructor as argument
• Building Projects: [tvOS] "Persistent Storage" dialog will continue to fill your ui.log with silent errors until GM is closed
• Code Editor: GM unstable when typing a dot after the square brackets of an array
• Code Editor: Tab name only uses lower case letters
• Debugger: GM hangs when debugging Toasty (and other projects which work with the new "ref" type in 2022.6)
• Debugger: GM hangs when debugging instance_create_layer() due to new "ref" type in 2022.6
• Debugger: GM unstable when passing "id" as parameter to function and putting a breakpoint inside the function
• Debugger: Originating code is not shown when hitting a breakpoint located on a line which has } at the end
• Debugger: Possible to not have the debugger re-enable the play button when hitting a breakpoint
• Device Manager: "Detect Device" for iOS and tvOS do not fill in the device details in Aug22
• Device Manager: [Mac IDE] "Launch Simulator" for iOS and tvOS launches the last simulator used
• Feather: "delete" is not flagging GM1052 on constructor functions created by "new", leading to unexpected in-game error
• Feather: "id" in-built variable is treated as read-only when assigned-to inside structs (e.g. "self.id = 1;")
• Feather: "with" loops cannot recognise arbitrary expressions
• Feather: Add a new "Unconstrained" style to each type on the Naming Rules screen
• Feather: Add filters and column-sorting into the Messages window
• Feather: Autocomplete sometimes does not show all matching results, gives fewer matches than the old version does
• Feather: Autocompletion window disappears when typing long identifiers near the end of a file
• Feather: Function tooltips do not support any multi-line content which is defined in the JSDoc
• Feather: GM crashes when showing tooltip or auto-complete for expressions which contain recursive macros
• Feather: GM2043 is never raised if an out-of-scope local variable is assigned to a new declaration of the same name
• Feather: Helper popups should never cover the line of code the caret is on
• Feather: If JSDoc sets "@returns Any" that function's "return" command always shows a warning about its type not being correct
• Feather: Immediate dot-access on struct literals raise an unexpected GM1012 error on valid code
• Feather: Implement improvements to "union" type support
• Feather: Macros incorrectly marked as recursive in some cases, shows unexpected GM1100
• Feather: Macros with Configs do not rewrite correctly
• Feather: Multiple issues with interpreting arrays or structs created from passing an array into "new"
• Feather: Output log fills up with "Unable find function 'ent_player_Event_Create$$anon_function ...', which should exist!", slowing the IDE
• Feather: Parameters only keep their type as "Any" until one with a default value is used, should always follow their JSDoc values and warn when mismatch detected
• Feather: Prefix operators following a semicolon are incorrectly parsed as ";++"
• Feather: Quick Fix to generate JSDoc mangles documentation in various ways
• Feather: Quick Fixes do not appear inside of function bodies
• Feather: Reassigning a macro to be an anonymous function created by "new" results in type-inference breaking
• Feather: Rendering tooltips of enums with too many members does not fit into the IDE window
• Feather: Repeated "unable to find function" messages shown in output after declaring a method variable
• Feather: Unexpected "Error Rewriting" for GM2001 when nested parentheses are used
• Feather: Suggestion GM2061 is raised even if the condition has an else branch
• Feather: Syntax highlighting for tooltips isn't correct
• Feather: Tooltips do not display for dereferenced variables of type 'Any'
• Feather: Tooltips do not display in deeply nested functions
• Feather: Tooltips for global variables should display the "global." prefix
• Feather: Type of arg[0]() is incorrectly inferred as Function instead of Array(Function)
• Feather: Type of argument[i] is incorrectly determined
• Feather: Unmatched curly braces do not raise an error
• Feather: layer_enable_fx() second argument is treated as "undefined", so gives unexpected warnings
• Feather: sprite_index and mask_index are treated as not allowing -1 as a valid assignment
• File Watcher: [Mac IDE] Should ignore any .DS_Store files which appear in the save location on disk, rather than adding them into the project .yyp
• Game Options: [Opera GX] Deleted games still show in your Game List
• GXC Integration: Game uploads fail if the Game Options "Game Name" value contains an underscore (and some other special characters)
• Inspector: [Animation Curve] Unable to paste a copied curve
• Inspector: [Font] Turns blank after regenerating a font texture when all glyphs are selected
• Localisation: Redefine Keys' "Delete" entry is not localised for Japanese
• Localisation: References to "Drag and Drop" (rather than "GML Visual") can still be found in some strings

• Marketplace Integration: [Light skin] Asset Import dialog text turns invisible when an item is selected
• Preferences: General's "IDE Font" label is not translated, is always English
• Preferences: JetBrains font uses a replacement font for Chinese glyphs, but the other font is not refreshed when JetBrains selected, gives missing characters inside GM
• Preferences: [Ubuntu IDE] Android SDK/NDK/JDK fields do not accept paths chosen in picker, require editing via keyboard
• Project Import: [Mac IDE] 2022.6 cannot import GM 2.2.5-and-older projects
• Project Load: [Mac IDE] Cannot open projects direct from Finder via their .yyp file / Project Load: [Mac IDE] Right-clicking .yyp files and "open with" shows Start Page, not the Import dialog
• Room Editor: GM crashes (on certain monitors) when opening room creation code if the currently-selected layer is a filter layer
• Room Editor: GM crashes when scrolling enough that the room goes off-screen whilst a filter layer is being previewed
• Room Editor: Rename filter layer "Rgb1/2/3" parameters to specify which one of R, G or B that setting actually affects
• Room Editor: Windblown Particle Effect settings are not localised, always use English
• UI/UX: [Mac IDE] Laptop status is always set to false, so Macbooks do not use the expected hotkeys in some cases
• UI/UX: [Mac IDE] Touchpad scrolling no longer uses the OS's "inertia" value
• UI/UX: [Ubuntu IDE] Update libGTK 2 linkage to use libGTK 3 instead
• Workspaces: [Vulkan] Performance drops after dragging a workspace out to be a new child window multiple times whilst a room is opened

• However, this new format is not compatible with older IDEs/runtimes and so accordingly we have introduced a new safeguard in this version, should you attempt to open a project in an older IDE again.

• The next time a room containing a tile layer is edited in the newer IDE, this will potentially upgrade all the tile data and save it in a "TileCompressedData" variable in the room’s own .yyp file - at this point, this project cannot be loaded into previous IDEs as it won’t understand it. (The project would also lack all the tiles information if you used a current IDE but with a runtime from 2022.6 or older.)

• Please note if the room wouldn't benefit from the compression, GameMaker will continue to store the data in the old-style "TileSerialiseData" variable - this is the same format as before and previous IDEs can open it if you need to; however, you will need to follow the steps in our FAQ for opening “too new” projects in older IDEs
Additional Feather Functionality
<ul>
• Naming Rules now have a new value of "Unconstrained", which you can set to tell Feather to allow any naming convention when dealing with certain aspects of your code
Additional Extension Options Functionality
<ul>
• Added combobox gadget support into the extension options editor and also the ability to mark settings as hidden to the “user-facing” extension options
• Added support for native-language Android/iOS extensions to access your extension options values, as set in the IDE
Misc Important Changes To Be Aware Of
<ul>

• Building Projects: Sound assets with invalid or non-existent underlying files are still embedded in the game, should error instead [now you will be asked to fix problem sounds before the build will succeed - note that those sounds would not have worked correctly in-game in previous releases, and our only change here is that you were not told this]
Other Bugs Fixed
<ul>
• Asset Browser: Unable to delete multiple Tags at once in Quick Access
• Building Projects: Clean up "hobby subscription" code and remove associated splash screens from the runtimes
• Building Projects: Compiler hangs for a minute or more on "Found Project Format 2" on attached project
• Building Projects: Switch builds no longer contain the IDE version number in their metadata, can cause submission fails
• Building Projects: Texture pages are being re-written every run in 2022.6.0, causing long build times
• Building Projects: Ubuntu IDE cannot build Android YYC for projects with extensions
• Building Projects: [HTML5] Global-scope macros which call in-built variables will cause a build error
• Building Projects: [Mac IDE] Building archives for iOS and tvOS will not show Xcode Organiser on completion
• Building Projects: [Mac IDE] HTML5 and Android targets do not open Finder when the build has succeeded
• Building Projects: [Ubuntu IDE] Android, HTML5, and Ubuntu builds don't open the file browser to show the resulting package
• Building Projects: [Ubuntu IDE] Ubuntu builds fail when targeting the local machine
• Building Projects: [Ubuntu] Unable to build if targeting a 22.04 LTS machine, due to "Permission denied (publickey)"
• Building Projects: [Windows] Builds can fail if Windows is set to some language/region format styles, giving "startIndex cannot be larger than length of string" error

• Building Projects: [YYC] Build fails when using parent constructor and new constructor as argument
• Building Projects: [tvOS] "Persistent Storage" dialog will continue to fill your ui.log with silent errors until GM is closed
• Code Editor: GM unstable when typing a dot after the square brackets of an array
• Code Editor: Tab name only uses lower case letters
• Debugger: GM hangs when debugging Toasty (and other projects which work with the new "ref" type in 2022.6)
• Debugger: GM hangs when debugging instance_create_layer() due to new "ref" type in 2022.6
• Debugger: GM unstable when passing "id" as parameter to function and putting a breakpoint inside the function
• Debugger: Originating code is not shown when hitting a breakpoint located on a line which has } at the end
• Debugger: Possible to not have the debugger re-enable the play button when hitting a breakpoint
• Device Manager: "Detect Device" for iOS and tvOS do not fill in the device details in Aug22
• Device Manager: [Mac IDE] "Launch Simulator" for iOS and tvOS launches the last simulator used
• Feather: "delete" is not flagging GM1052 on constructor functions created by "new", leading to unexpected in-game error
• Feather: "id" in-built variable is treated as read-only when assigned-to inside structs (e.g. "self.id = 1;")
• Feather: "with" loops cannot recognise arbitrary expressions
• Feather: Add a new "Unconstrained" style to each type on the Naming Rules screen
• Feather: Add filters and column-sorting into the Messages window
• Feather: Autocomplete sometimes does not show all matching results, gives fewer matches than the old version does
• Feather: Autocompletion window disappears when typing long identifiers near the end of a file
• Feather: Function tooltips do not support any multi-line content which is defined in the JSDoc
• Feather: GM crashes when showing tooltip or auto-complete for expressions which contain recursive macros
• Feather: GM2043 is never raised if an out-of-scope local variable is assigned to a new declaration of the same name
• Feather: Helper popups should never cover the line of code the caret is on
• Feather: If JSDoc sets "@returns Any" that function's "return" command always shows a warning about its type not being correct
• Feather: Immediate dot-access on struct literals raise an unexpected GM1012 error on valid code
• Feather: Implement improvements to "union" type support
• Feather: Macros incorrectly marked as recursive in some cases, shows unexpected GM1100
• Feather: Macros with Configs do not rewrite correctly
• Feather: Multiple issues with interpreting arrays or structs created from passing an array into "new"
• Feather: Output log fills up with "Unable find function 'ent_player_Event_Create$$anon_function ...', which should exist!", slowing the IDE
• Feather: Parameters only keep their type as "Any" until one with a default value is used, should always follow their JSDoc values and warn when mismatch detected
• Feather: Prefix operators following a semicolon are incorrectly parsed as ";++"
• Feather: Quick Fix to generate JSDoc mangles documentation in various ways
• Feather: Quick Fixes do not appear inside of function bodies
• Feather: Reassigning a macro to be an anonymous function created by "new" results in type-inference breaking
• Feather: Rendering tooltips of enums with too many members does not fit into the IDE window
• Feather: Repeated "unable to find function" messages shown in output after declaring a method variable
• Feather: Unexpected "Error Rewriting" for GM2001 when nested parentheses are used
• Feather: Suggestion GM2061 is raised even if the condition has an else branch
• Feather: Syntax highlighting for tooltips isn't correct
• Feather: Tooltips do not display for dereferenced variables of type 'Any'
• Feather: Tooltips do not display in deeply nested functions
• Feather: Tooltips for global variables should display the "global." prefix
• Feather: Type of arg[0]() is incorrectly inferred as Function instead of Array(Function)
• Feather: Type of argument[i] is incorrectly determined
• Feather: Unmatched curly braces do not raise an error
• Feather: layer_enable_fx() second argument is treated as "undefined", so gives unexpected warnings
• Feather: sprite_index and mask_index are treated as not allowing -1 as a valid assignment
• File Watcher: [Mac IDE] Should ignore any .DS_Store files which appear in the save location on disk, rather than adding them into the project .yyp
• Game Options: [Opera GX] Deleted games still show in your Game List
• GXC Integration: Game uploads fail if the Game Options "Game Name" value contains an underscore (and some other special characters)
• Inspector: [Animation Curve] Unable to paste a copied curve
• Inspector: [Font] Turns blank after regenerating a font texture when all glyphs are selected
• Localisation: Redefine Keys' "Delete" entry is not localised for Japanese
• Localisation: References to "Drag and Drop" (rather than "GML Visual") can still be found in some strings
• Localisation: Update IDE translations to account for changes in 2022.6
• Marketplace Integration: [Light skin] Asset Import dialog text turns invisible when an item is selected
• Preferences: General's "IDE Font" label is not translated, is always English
• Preferences: JetBrains font uses a replacement font for Chinese glyphs, but the other font is not refreshed when JetBrains selected, gives missing characters inside GM
• Preferences: [Ubuntu IDE] Android SDK/NDK/JDK fields do not accept paths chosen in picker, require editing via keyboard
• Project Import: [Mac IDE] 2022.6 cannot import GM 2.2.5-and-older projects
• Project Load: [Mac IDE] Cannot open projects direct from Finder via their .yyp file / Project Load: [Mac IDE] Right-clicking .yyp files and "open with" shows Start Page, not the Import dialog
• Room Editor: GM crashes (on certain monitors) when opening room creation code if the currently-selected layer is a filter layer
• Room Editor: GM crashes when scrolling enough that the room goes off-screen whilst a filter layer is being previewed
• Room Editor: Rename filter layer "Rgb1/2/3" parameters to specify which one of R, G or B that setting actually affects
• Room Editor: Windblown Particle Effect settings are not localised, always use English
• UI/UX: [Mac IDE] Laptop status is always set to false, so Macbooks do not use the expected hotkeys in some cases
• UI/UX: [Mac IDE] Touchpad scrolling no longer uses the OS's "inertia" value
• UI/UX: [Ubuntu IDE] Update libGTK 2 linkage to use libGTK 3 instead
• Workspaces: [Vulkan] Performance drops after dragging a workspace out to be a new child window multiple times whilst a room is opened
Removed Some Legacy Platforms/Architectures
<ul>
• Some lesser-used or largely redundant versions of the targets have now been removed, so we can focus support on the current tools instead. These are:
• Android x86 architecture (x86_64 is still there, so you can still use 64bit emulators)

<li>UWP target has been removed entirely, as the Windows store has accepted native packages for a while and the GDK extension can be used to implement current versions of Microsoft’s social functionality
• Windows x86 (32bit support) architecture has been removed from Game Options, so now only 64bit executables are available
• Xbox One Legacy (XDK) target has been removed entirely, as GDK has been available for a while
Project Format Changes For Tile Layers In Rooms
<ul>

• We have introduced a new, much faster method for storing tile data in your rooms and passing this information into your builds - which fixes a long-time issue where rooms with lots of tile slots could see a pause on the line "Found Project Format 2" in their output log

• However, this new format is not compatible with older IDEs/runtimes and so accordingly we have introduced a new safeguard in this version, should you attempt to open a project in an older IDE again.
• On opening the project in any version newer than 2022.6 GameMaker will raise the project version automatically to be 1.6

• The next time a room containing a tile layer is edited in the newer IDE, this will potentially upgrade all the tile data and save it in a "TileCompressedData" variable in the room’s own .yyp file - at this point, this project cannot be loaded into previous IDEs as it won’t understand it. (The project would also lack all the tiles information if you used a current IDE but with a runtime from 2022.6 or older.)

• Please note if the room wouldn't benefit from the compression, GameMaker will continue to store the data in the old-style "TileSerialiseData" variable - this is the same format as before and previous IDEs can open it if you need to; however, you will need to follow the steps in our FAQ for opening “too new” projects in older IDEs
Additional Feather Functionality
<ul>
• New functions and a rollback event have been added for providing chat functionality to your players
• New Visual nodes have been added for the above, plus some others which were missing from earlier Betas - and Toolbox icons have been fixed for the existing rollback nodes
Additional Feather Functionality
<ul>
• Naming Rules now have a new value of "Unconstrained", which you can set to tell Feather to allow any naming convention when dealing with certain aspects of your code

• Added support for native-language Android/iOS extensions to access your extension options values, as set in the IDE

• Room Editor: Rename filter layer "Rgb1/2/3" parameters to specify which one of R, G or B that setting actually affects
• Room Editor: Windblown Particle Effect settings are not localised, always use English
• Room Editor: Filter settings for "Boxes" and "Stripes Background" have same setting, but use different labels and range for it
• UI/UX: [Mac IDE] Laptop status is always set to false, so Macbooks do not use the expected hotkeys in some cases
• UI/UX: [Mac IDE] Touchpad scrolling no longer uses the OS's "inertia" value
• UI/UX: [Ubuntu IDE] Update libGTK 2 linkage to use libGTK 3 instead
• Workspaces: [Vulkan] Performance drops after dragging a workspace out to be a new child window multiple times whilst a room is opened
Removed Some Legacy Platforms/Architectures
<ul>
• Some lesser-used or largely redundant versions of the targets have now been removed, so we can focus support on the current tools instead. These are:
• Android x86 architecture (x86_64 is still there, so you can still use 64bit emulators)

<li>UWP target has been removed entirely, as the Windows store has accepted native packages for a while and the GDK extension can be used to implement current versions of Microsoft’s social functionality
• Windows x86 (32bit support) architecture has been removed from Game Options, so now only 64bit executables are available
• Xbox One Legacy (XDK) target has been removed entirely, as GDK has been available for a while
Project Format Changes For Tile Layers In Rooms
<ul>

• We have introduced a new, much faster method for storing tile data in your rooms and passing this information into your builds - which fixes a long-time issue where rooms with lots of tile slots could see a pause on the line "Found Project Format 2" in their output log

• However, this new format is not compatible with older IDEs/runtimes and so accordingly we have introduced a new safeguard in this version, should you attempt to open a project in an older IDE again.
• On opening the project in any version newer than 2022.6 GameMaker will raise the project version automatically to be 1.6

• The next time a room containing a tile layer is edited in the newer IDE, this will potentially upgrade all the tile data and save it in a "TileCompressedData" variable in the room’s own .yyp file - at this point, this project cannot be loaded into previous IDEs as it won’t understand it. (The project would also lack all the tiles information if you used a current IDE but with a runtime from 2022.6 or older.)

• Please note if the room wouldn't benefit from the compression, GameMaker will continue to store the data in the old-style "TileSerialiseData" variable - this is the same format as before and previous IDEs can open it if you need to; however, you will need to follow the steps in our FAQ for opening “too new” projects in older IDEs
Additional Feather Functionality
<ul>
• New functions and a rollback event have been added for providing chat functionality to your players
• New Visual nodes have been added for the above, plus some others which were missing from earlier Betas - and Toolbox icons have been fixed for the existing rollback nodes
Additional Feather Functionality
<ul>
• Naming Rules now have a new value of "Unconstrained", which you can set to tell Feather to allow any naming convention when dealing with certain aspects of your code
Additional Extension Options Functionality
<ul>
• Added combobox gadget support into the extension options editor and also the ability to mark settings as hidden to the “user-facing” extension options
• Added support for native-language Android/iOS extensions to access your extension options values, as set in the IDE
Misc Important Changes To Be Aware Of
<ul>

• Building Projects: Sound assets with invalid or non-existent underlying files are still embedded in the game, should error instead [now you will be asked to fix problem sounds before the build will succeed - note that those sounds would not have worked correctly in-game in previous releases, and our only change here is that you were not told this]
Other Bugs Fixed
<ul>
• Asset Browser: Unable to delete multiple Tags at once in Quick Access
• Building Projects: Clean up "hobby subscription" code and remove associated splash screens from the runtimes
• Building Projects: Compiler hangs for a minute or more on "Found Project Format 2" on attached project
• Building Projects: Switch builds no longer contain the IDE version number in their metadata, can cause submission fails
• Building Projects: Texture pages are being re-written every run in 2022.6.0, causing long build times
• Building Projects: Ubuntu IDE cannot build Android YYC for projects with extensions
• Building Projects: [HTML5] Global-scope macros which call in-built variables will cause a build error
• Building Projects: [Mac IDE] Building archives for iOS and tvOS will not show Xcode Organiser on completion
• Building Projects: [Mac IDE] HTML5 and Android targets do not open Finder when the build has succeeded
• Building Projects: [Ubuntu IDE] Android, HTML5, and Ubuntu builds don't open the file browser to show the resulting package
• Building Projects: [Ubuntu IDE] Ubuntu builds fail when targeting the local machine
• Building Projects: [Ubuntu] Unable to build if targeting a 22.04 LTS machine, due to "Permission denied (publickey)"
• Building Projects: [Windows] Builds can fail if Windows is set to some language/region format styles, giving "startIndex cannot be larger than length of string" error
• Building Projects: Game Options > Windows values are not passed into NSIS builds, so .exes don't show copyright, etc. correctly in Windows dialogs
• Building Projects: [Xbox GDK] Add new Preference for whether to deploy the package after a Create Exe
• Building Projects: [YYC] Build fails when using parent constructor and new constructor as argument
• Building Projects: [tvOS] "Persistent Storage" dialog will continue to fill your ui.log with silent errors until GM is closed
• Code Editor: GM unstable when typing a dot after the square brackets of an array
• Code Editor: Tab name only uses lower case letters
• Debugger: GM hangs when debugging Toasty (and other projects which work with the new "ref" type in 2022.6)
• Debugger: GM hangs when debugging instance_create_layer() due to new "ref" type in 2022.6
• Debugger: GM unstable when passing "id" as parameter to function and putting a breakpoint inside the function
• Debugger: Originating code is not shown when hitting a breakpoint located on a line which has } at the end
• Debugger: Possible to not have the debugger re-enable the play button when hitting a breakpoint
• Device Manager: "Detect Device" for iOS and tvOS do not fill in the device details in Aug22
• Device Manager: [Mac IDE] "Launch Simulator" for iOS and tvOS launches the last simulator used
• Feather: "delete" is not flagging GM1052 on constructor functions created by "new", leading to unexpected in-game error
• Feather: "id" in-built variable is treated as read-only when assigned-to inside structs (e.g. "self.id = 1;")
• Feather: "with" loops cannot recognise arbitrary expressions
• Feather: Add a new "Unconstrained" style to each type on the Naming Rules screen
• Feather: Add filters and column-sorting into the Messages window
• Feather: Autocomplete sometimes does not show all matching results, gives fewer matches than the old version does
• Feather: Autocompletion window disappears when typing long identifiers near the end of a file
• Feather: Function tooltips do not support any multi-line content which is defined in the JSDoc
• Feather: GM crashes when showing tooltip or auto-complete for expressions which contain recursive macros
• Feather: GM2043 is never raised if an out-of-scope local variable is assigned to a new declaration of the same name
• Feather: Helper popups should never cover the line of code the caret is on
• Feather: If JSDoc sets "@returns Any" that function's "return" command always shows a warning about its type not being correct
• Feather: Immediate dot-access on struct literals raise an unexpected GM1012 error on valid code
• Feather: Implement improvements to "union" type support
• Feather: Macros incorrectly marked as recursive in some cases, shows unexpected GM1100
• Feather: Macros with Configs do not rewrite correctly
• Feather: Multiple issues with interpreting arrays or structs created from passing an array into "new"
• Feather: Output log fills up with "Unable find function 'ent_player_Event_Create$$anon_function ...', which should exist!", slowing the IDE
• Feather: Parameters only keep their type as "Any" until one with a default value is used, should always follow their JSDoc values and warn when mismatch detected
• Feather: Prefix operators following a semicolon are incorrectly parsed as ";++"
• Feather: Quick Fix to generate JSDoc mangles documentation in various ways
• Feather: Quick Fixes do not appear inside of function bodies
• Feather: Reassigning a macro to be an anonymous function created by "new" results in type-inference breaking
• Feather: Rendering tooltips of enums with too many members does not fit into the IDE window
• Feather: Repeated "unable to find function" messages shown in output after declaring a method variable
• Feather: Unexpected "Error Rewriting" for GM2001 when nested parentheses are used
• Feather: Suggestion GM2061 is raised even if the condition has an else branch
• Feather: Syntax highlighting for tooltips isn't correct
• Feather: Tooltips do not display for dereferenced variables of type 'Any'
• Feather: Tooltips do not display in deeply nested functions
• Feather: Tooltips for global variables should display the "global." prefix
• Feather: Type of arg[0]() is incorrectly inferred as Function instead of Array(Function)
• Feather: Type of argument[i] is incorrectly determined
• Feather: Unmatched curly braces do not raise an error
• Feather: layer_enable_fx() second argument is treated as "undefined", so gives unexpected warnings
• Feather: sprite_index and mask_index are treated as not allowing -1 as a valid assignment
• File Watcher: [Mac IDE] Should ignore any .DS_Store files which appear in the save location on disk, rather than adding them into the project .yyp
• Game Options: [Opera GX] Deleted games still show in your Game List
• GXC Integration: Game uploads fail if the Game Options "Game Name" value contains an underscore (and some other special characters)
• Inspector: [Animation Curve] Unable to paste a copied curve
• Inspector: [Font] Turns blank after regenerating a font texture when all glyphs are selected
• Localisation: Redefine Keys' "Delete" entry is not localised for Japanese
• Localisation: References to "Drag and Drop" (rather than "GML Visual") can still be found in some strings
• Localisation: Update IDE translations to account for changes in 2022.6
• Marketplace Integration: [Light skin] Asset Import dialog text turns invisible when an item is selected
• Object Editor: [Light skin] Sprite previews are just a black square
• Preferences: General's "IDE Font" label is not translated, is always English
• Preferences: JetBrains font uses a replacement font for Chinese glyphs, but the other font is not refreshed when JetBrains selected, gives missing characters inside GM
• Preferences: [Ubuntu IDE] Android SDK/NDK/JDK fields do not accept paths chosen in picker, require editing via keyboard
• Project Import: [Mac IDE] 2022.6 cannot import GM 2.2.5-and-older projects
• Project Load: [Mac IDE] Cannot open projects direct from Finder via their .yyp file / Project Load: [Mac IDE] Right-clicking .yyp files and "open with" shows Start Page, not the Import dialog

• UI/UX: [Mac IDE] Touchpad scrolling no longer uses the OS's "inertia" value
• UI/UX: [Ubuntu IDE] Update libGTK 2 linkage to use libGTK 3 instead

• Feather: Syntax highlighting for tooltips isn't correct
• Feather: Tooltips do not display for dereferenced variables of type 'Any'
• Feather: Tooltips do not display in deeply nested functions
• Feather: Tooltips for global variables should display the "global." prefix

• Feather: Type of argument[i] is incorrectly determined
• Feather: Unmatched curly braces do not raise an error

Changes Since Monthly IDE 2022.6.0.23
Removed Some Legacy Platforms/Architectures
<ul>
• Some lesser-used or largely redundant versions of the targets have now been removed, so we can focus support on the current tools instead. These are:
• Android x86 architecture (x86_64 is still there, so you can still use 64bit emulators)

<li>UWP target has been removed entirely, as the Windows store has accepted native packages for a while and the GDK extension can be used to implement current versions of Microsoft’s social functionality
• Windows x86 (32bit support) architecture has been removed from Game Options, so now only 64bit executables are available
• Xbox One Legacy (XDK) target has been removed entirely, as GDK has been available for a while
Project Format Changes For Tile Layers In Rooms
<ul>

• We have introduced a new, much faster method for storing tile data in your rooms and passing this information into your builds - which fixes a long-time issue where rooms with lots of tile slots could see a pause on the line "Found Project Format 2" in their output log

• However, this new format is not compatible with older IDEs/runtimes and so accordingly we have introduced a new safeguard in this version, should you attempt to open a project in an older IDE again.
• On opening the project in any version newer than 2022.6 GameMaker will raise the project version automatically to be 1.6

• The next time a room containing a tile layer is edited in the newer IDE, this will potentially upgrade all the tile data and save it in a "TileCompressedData" variable in the room’s own .yyp file - at this point, this project cannot be loaded into previous IDEs as it won’t understand it. (The project would also lack all the tiles information if you used a current IDE but with a runtime from 2022.6 or older.)

• Please note if the room wouldn't benefit from the compression, GameMaker will continue to store the data in the old-style "TileSerialiseData" variable - this is the same format as before and previous IDEs can open it if you need to; however, you will need to follow the steps in our FAQ for opening “too new” projects in older IDEs
Additional Feather Functionality
<ul>
• New functions and a rollback event have been added for providing chat functionality to your players
• New Visual nodes have been added for the above, plus some others which were missing from earlier Betas - and Toolbox icons have been fixed for the existing rollback nodes
Additional Feather Functionality
<ul>
• Naming Rules now have a new value of "Unconstrained", which you can set to tell Feather to allow any naming convention when dealing with certain aspects of your code
Additional Extension Options Functionality
<ul>
• Added combobox gadget support into the extension options editor and also the ability to mark settings as hidden to the “user-facing” extension options
• Added support for native-language Android/iOS extensions to access your extension options values, as set in the IDE
Misc Important Changes To Be Aware Of
<ul>

• Building Projects: Sound assets with invalid or non-existent underlying files are still embedded in the game, should error instead [now you will be asked to fix problem sounds before the build will succeed - note that those sounds would not have worked correctly in-game in previous releases, and our only change here is that you were not told this]

Changes Since Beta IDE 187
Added Opera GX Game Options SSO Account Label
<ul>

• In previous releases there was no indication/error given if a game registration failed because you were actually logged-in as a different SSO account in your browser to the one you had logged-into GM with

• Now, Game Options tells you which account GameMaker will use to register/upload your games to (or if you're not actually logged-in yet), so you can more easily see when there is an upload fail due to a simple account mismatch
• Note: if you do happen to use multiple Opera accounts, then you should continue to make sure your web browser is signed-in to the one you need before doing any uploads
Misc Important Changes To Be Aware Of
<ul>

• Added support for Android's "ProGuard" minifying and shrinking options - you can now enable these in Game Options if you wish (defaults to off) and the corresponding steps will then be performed during your builds
• Also added $YYAndroidProguard as a tag so that your extensions can inject into the proguard.pro file
Other Bugs Fixed
<ul>
• Asset Browser: GM crashes when duplicating a sprite in some 800 Betas
• Building Projects: [YYC] Builds fail if struct member names are strings containing spaces
• Building Projects: [macOS] Fixed an issue where some special characters (such as apostrophes and brackets) were not escaped properly and so caused builds to fail
• Code Editor (Visual): Typing "x" and "y" in instance creation code editors will also modify its Flip X/Y values in the room

• Note that there were actual several ways in which Room Editor commands could be accidentally triggered when typing in GML Visual editors which were open over the top of the room, and the fix above should resolve all of them
• GXC Integration: GM silently fails to register a new game on gx.games if browser account differs from IDE account [see the Game Options mention higher up]
• Room Editor: GM unstable when attempting to paste an instance into the room in some 800 Betas / Room Editor: Copy-and-pasting assets results in an empty asset in some 800 Betas
• Sequence Editor: Removed a redundant "Asset Track" variable from sequence instances
• UI/UX: [Mac IDE] Dock icon "Quit" option doesn't actually close GM
Beta IDE 187
Resource Refactor
<ul>
• This beta introduces a big clean-up to how assets are handled, which should have very minor impact on your usage just now but will make future releases far more stable
• There may be minor changes to the file format of some resources, sol please be aware of this if you're committed to source control and seeing some unexpected changes
New "Modes" For Feather
<ul>
• Added a new Preference for Relaxed Type vs Strict Type Checking

• Also added a new Preference for controlling the amount of warnings Feather wil show you in the code editor. You can now select between varying levels in the dropdown, which progressively enable more of the current warnings: "None" (which is compile errors only), "Syntax Errors" (which is syntax errors and compile errors),"Type Errors" (which adds variable type enforcement warnings), and "All" (everything Feather offers)
Misc Important Changes To Be Aware Of
<ul>

• Case-Insensitve file names are back - please be aware of this if you are moving projects between OS installs which use different naming conventions (or when committing into Git source-control repos)
Other Bugs Fixed
<ul>
• Crash Reporter: Fixed an issue in the last Beta where if a crash needed to be uploaded, then this caused the startup commands to be wrong when GM was restarted
• Debugger: [Mac IDE] Fixed the window jumping about when resetting to a maximised state
• Extension Editor: Extension Options section now has a "Reset To Default" button
• Feather: GM1059 being raised against a function declaration line blocks parsing of that function's body
• Feather: Anonymous functions declared in another function's parameter initialisation are not found later, gives unexpected "Unable to find function"
• Feather: Macro errors GM1038 and GM1051 are not always shown when the project's code should cause them to be
• Inspector: Added a highlight for the selected instance when using the Room Editor, so you can easily see which instance you're inspecting
• Project Load: Object Editor and Inspector can show same child listed twice in child list when reloading the project [might have seen this in the previous Beta]
• Room Editor: [SP] Untranslated description of path layer shown in status bar
• UI/UX: Platform selector gadget needs the legacy targets Xbox (XDK) and UWP to be removed

Changes Since Beta IDE 187
Added Opera GX Game Options SSO Account Label
<ul>

• In previous releases there was no indication/error given if a game registration failed because you were actually logged-in as a different SSO account in your browser to the one you had logged-into GM with

• Now, Game Options tells you which account GameMaker will use to register/upload your games to (or if you're not actually logged-in yet), so you can more easily see when there is an upload fail due to a simple account mismatch
• Note: if you do happen to use multiple Opera accounts, then you should continue to make sure your web browser is signed-in to the one you need before doing any uploads
Misc Important Changes To Be Aware Of
<ul>

• Added support for Android's "ProGuard" minifying and shrinking options - you can now enable these in Game Options if you wish (defaults to off) and the corresponding steps will then be performed during your builds
• Also added $YYAndroidProguard as a tag so that your extensions can inject into the proguard.pro file

• Included Files: GM crashes after adding multiple files at once to Datafiles directory [note that the fix for this one means empty folders wil no longer be shown in the Included Files editor window, but they are still on disk just fine]
Other Bugs Fixed
<ul>
• Asset Browser: GM crashes when duplicating a sprite in some 800 Betas
• Asset Browser: GM crash when deleting a corrupted sequence/sprite created in 800 Betas
• Building Projects: [YYC] Builds fail if struct member names are strings containing spaces
• Building Projects: [macOS] Fixed an issue where some special characters (such as apostrophes and brackets) were not escaped properly and so caused builds to fail
• Building Projects: [HTML5] index.html is included twice in package if a custom .html is selected in Game Options

• Building Projects: "Stripes Background" filter type will draw parts of other sprites in-game if the one chosen has not been set as on its own texture page [this actually is the same recommendation for several filter types, so now the IDE will warn you if your chosen sprite has not been marked as being on a textuire page by itself]
• Code Editor: Rollback variables "player_id" and "player_local" are not coloured as built-in variables
• Code Editor: network_send_raw(), skeleton_animation_set() and skeleton_animation_set_ext() all now correctly have their final argument marked as optional in autocomplete
• Code Editor (Visual): Typing "x" and "y" in instance creation code editors will also modify its Flip X/Y values in the room

• Note that there were actual several ways in which Room Editor commands could be accidentally triggered when typing in GML Visual editors which were open over the top of the room, and the fix above should resolve all of them
• Feather: gamepad_get_device_count() description needs to show more content from the manual in order to be useful
• Feather: http_request() is not treated as if it accepts Id.Buffer or Real types, gives unexpected Error GM1041 messages
• Feather: instance_activate_object() is not treated as allowing Id.Instance types, gives unexpected Warning GM1044 messages
• Feather: network_destroy() is not treated as accepting Id.Socket types, always gives unexpected Error GM1041 messages
• Feather: "player_id" and all other rollback multiplayer variable always cause unexpected Error GM1013 messages
• Feather: script_exists() causes unexpected Warning GM1029 messages
• GXC Integration: GM silently fails to register a new game on gx.games if browser account differs from IDE account [see the Game Options mention higher up]
• Project Save: Sprites made in 800 Betas can lose their content after reopening the project
• Project Save: Serializing of an object which has a collision event with itself causes an exception when saving
• Redefine Keys: "Show code snippets" no longer has an entry in the list
• Room Editor: GM unstable when attempting to paste an instance into the room in some 800 Betas / Room Editor: Copy-and-pasting assets results in an empty asset in some 800 Betas
• Sequence Editor: Removed a redundant "Asset Track" variable from sequence instances
• Sequence Editor: Unable to convert a parameter track to be a curve in 800 Betas
• UI/UX: [Mac IDE] Dock icon "Quit" option doesn't actually close GM
Beta IDE 187
Resource Refactor
<ul>
• This beta introduces a big clean-up to how assets are handled, which should have very minor impact on your usage just now but will make future releases far more stable
• There may be minor changes to the file format of some resources, sol please be aware of this if you're committed to source control and seeing some unexpected changes
New "Modes" For Feather
<ul>
• Added a new Preference for Relaxed Type vs Strict Type Checking

• Also added a new Preference for controlling the amount of warnings Feather wil show you in the code editor. You can now select between varying levels in the dropdown, which progressively enable more of the current warnings: "None" (which is compile errors only), "Syntax Errors" (which is syntax errors and compile errors),"Type Errors" (which adds variable type enforcement warnings), and "All" (everything Feather offers)
Misc Important Changes To Be Aware Of
<ul>

• Case-Insensitve file names are back - please be aware of this if you are moving projects between OS installs which use different naming conventions (or when committing into Git source-control repos)
Other Bugs Fixed
<ul>
• Crash Reporter: Fixed an issue in the last Beta where if a crash needed to be uploaded, then this caused the startup commands to be wrong when GM was restarted
• Debugger: [Mac IDE] Fixed the window jumping about when resetting to a maximised state
• Extension Editor: Extension Options section now has a "Reset To Default" button
• Feather: GM1059 being raised against a function declaration line blocks parsing of that function's body
• Feather: Anonymous functions declared in another function's parameter initialisation are not found later, gives unexpected "Unable to find function"
• Feather: Macro errors GM1038 and GM1051 are not always shown when the project's code should cause them to be
• Inspector: Added a highlight for the selected instance when using the Room Editor, so you can easily see which instance you're inspecting
• Project Load: Object Editor and Inspector can show same child listed twice in child list when reloading the project [might have seen this in the previous Beta]
• Room Editor: [SP] Untranslated description of path layer shown in status bar
• UI/UX: Platform selector gadget needs the legacy targets Xbox (XDK) and UWP to be removed

Other Bugs Fixed
<ul>

• Preferences: Change "Enabled" to "Enable Feather" in Preferences
• Docs Integration: F1/middle button doesn't work as expected in the .800 Betas and new Monthly release
• Feather: GML Spec for console does not contain documentation and types

Beta IDE 165
Misc Important Changes To Be Aware Of
<ul>
• New version dialog box now contains a "Don't ask me again" option
• Add new nodes for rollback "manual start" and chat, plus add the new optional layer field into rollback_define_player
Other Bugs Fixed
<ul>
• Code Editor: [Visual] using arrow keys to move cursor when typing a comment simultaneously switches the focus between blocks
• Feather: Fluent API is not being parsed properly (e.g. new Fluent().foo().bar())
• Feather: The delete keyword is not flagging GM1052 on new'd constructor functions (e.g. delete new Fluent())
• Feather: Built-in variables incorrectly resolved when dot dereferencing, leading to incorrect GM1008 and GM1052 errors being raised
• Laptop Mode: Left Alt/option can still be used to create assests

Changes Since Monthly IDE 2022.6.1.26
Removed Some Legacy Platforms/Architectures
<ul>
• Some lesser-used or largely redundant versions of the targets have now been removed, so we can focus support on the current tools instead. These are:
• Android x86 architecture (x86_64 is still there, so you can still use 64bit emulators)

<li>UWP target has been removed entirely, as the Windows store has accepted native packages for a while and the GDK extension can be used to implement current versions of Microsoft’s social functionality
• Windows x86 (32bit support) architecture has been removed from Game Options, so now only 64bit executables are available
• Xbox One Legacy (XDK) target has been removed entirely, as GDK has been available for a while
Project Format Changes For Tile Layers In Rooms
<ul>

• We have introduced a new, much faster method for storing tile data in your rooms and passing this information into your builds - which fixes a long-time issue where rooms with lots of tile slots could see a pause on the line "Found Project Format 2" in their output log

• However, this new format is not compatible with older IDEs/runtimes and so accordingly we have introduced a new safeguard in this version, should you attempt to open a project in an older IDE again.
• On opening the project in any version newer than 2022.6 GameMaker will raise the project version automatically to be 1.6

• The next time a room containing a tile layer is edited in the newer IDE, this will potentially upgrade all the tile data and save it in a "TileCompressedData" variable in the room’s own .yyp file - at this point, this project cannot be loaded into previous IDEs as it won’t understand it. (The project would also lack all the tiles information if you used a current IDE but with a runtime from 2022.6 or older.)

• Please note if the room wouldn't benefit from the compression, GameMaker will continue to store the data in the old-style "TileSerialiseData" variable - this is the same format as before and previous IDEs can open it if you need to; however, you will need to follow the steps in our FAQ for opening “too new” projects in older IDEs
More Effect Layer Types
<ul>
• New filters have been added for Contrast, Fractal Noise, Gradient, Colour LUT ("Look-Up Table"), and Twist Blur
Additional Rollback Multiplayer Functionality
<ul>
• New functions and a rollback event have been added for providing chat functionality to your players
• New Visual nodes have been added for the above, plus some others which were missing from earlier Betas - and Toolbox icons have been fixed for the existing rollback nodes
Additional Feather Functionality
<ul>
• Naming Rules now have a new value of "Unconstrained", which you can set to tell Feather to allow any naming convention when dealing with certain aspects of your code
Additional Extension Options Functionality
<ul>
• Added combobox gadget support into the extension options editor and also the ability to mark settings as hidden to the “user-facing” extension options
• Added support for native-language Android/iOS extensions to access your extension options values, as set in the IDE
Misc Important Changes To Be Aware Of
<ul>

• Building Projects: Sound assets with invalid or non-existent underlying files are still embedded in the game, should error instead [now you will be asked to fix problem sounds before the build will succeed - note that those sounds would not have worked correctly in-game in previous releases, and our only change here is that you were not told this]

Beta IDE 165
Misc Important Changes To Be Aware Of
<ul>
• New version dialog box now contains a "Don't ask me again" option
• Add new nodes for rollback "manual start" and chat, plus add the new optional layer field into rollback_define_player
Other Bugs Fixed
<ul>
• Code Editor: [Visual] using arrow keys to move cursor when typing a comment simultaneously switches the focus between blocks
• Feather: Fluent API is not being parsed properly (e.g. new Fluent().foo().bar())
• Feather: The delete keyword is not flagging GM1052 on new'd constructor functions (e.g. delete new Fluent())
• Feather: Built-in variables incorrectly resolved when dot dereferencing, leading to incorrect GM1008 and GM1052 errors being raised
• Laptop Mode: Left Alt/option can still be used to create assests
• Object Editor: [Light skin] Sprite previews are just a black square
• Project Load : IDE freezes when loading a project when the project folder contains a folder named ".git"
• UI/UX: [Mac IDE] Minimise in the Menu Bar doesn't reenable after using it
Changes Since Monthly IDE 2022.6.1.26
Removed Some Legacy Platforms/Architectures
<ul>
• Some lesser-used or largely redundant versions of the targets have now been removed, so we can focus support on the current tools instead. These are:
• Android x86 architecture (x86_64 is still there, so you can still use 64bit emulators)

<li>UWP target has been removed entirely, as the Windows store has accepted native packages for a while and the GDK extension can be used to implement current versions of Microsoft’s social functionality
• Windows x86 (32bit support) architecture has been removed from Game Options, so now only 64bit executables are available
• Xbox One Legacy (XDK) target has been removed entirely, as GDK has been available for a while
Project Format Changes For Tile Layers In Rooms
<ul>

• We have introduced a new, much faster method for storing tile data in your rooms and passing this information into your builds - which fixes a long-time issue where rooms with lots of tile slots could see a pause on the line "Found Project Format 2" in their output log

• However, this new format is not compatible with older IDEs/runtimes and so accordingly we have introduced a new safeguard in this version, should you attempt to open a project in an older IDE again.
• On opening the project in any version newer than 2022.6 GameMaker will raise the project version automatically to be 1.6

• The next time a room containing a tile layer is edited in the newer IDE, this will potentially upgrade all the tile data and save it in a "TileCompressedData" variable in the room’s own .yyp file - at this point, this project cannot be loaded into previous IDEs as it won’t understand it. (The project would also lack all the tiles information if you used a current IDE but with a runtime from 2022.6 or older.)

• Please note if the room wouldn't benefit from the compression, GameMaker will continue to store the data in the old-style "TileSerialiseData" variable - this is the same format as before and previous IDEs can open it if you need to; however, you will need to follow the steps in our FAQ for opening “too new” projects in older IDEs
More Effect Layer Types
<ul>
• New filters have been added for Contrast, Fractal Noise, Gradient, Colour LUT ("Look-Up Table"), and Twist Blur
Additional Rollback Multiplayer Functionality
<ul>
• New functions and a rollback event have been added for providing chat functionality to your players
• New Visual nodes have been added for the above, plus some others which were missing from earlier Betas - and Toolbox icons have been fixed for the existing rollback nodes
Additional Feather Functionality
<ul>
• Naming Rules now have a new value of "Unconstrained", which you can set to tell Feather to allow any naming convention when dealing with certain aspects of your code
Additional Extension Options Functionality
<ul>
• Added combobox gadget support into the extension options editor and also the ability to mark settings as hidden to the “user-facing” extension options
• Added support for native-language Android/iOS extensions to access your extension options values, as set in the IDE
Misc Important Changes To Be Aware Of
<ul>

• Building Projects: Sound assets with invalid or non-existent underlying files are still embedded in the game, should error instead [now you will be asked to fix problem sounds before the build will succeed - note that those sounds would not have worked correctly in-game in previous releases, and our only change here is that you were not told this]
Other Bugs Fixed
<ul>
• Asset Browser: Unable to delete multiple Tags at once in Quick Access
• Building Projects: Clean up "hobby subscription" code and remove associated splash screens from the runtimes
• Building Projects: Compiler hangs for a minute or more on "Found Project Format 2" on attached project
• Building Projects: Texture pages are being re-written every run in 2022.6.0, causing long build times
• Building Projects: Ubuntu IDE cannot build Android YYC for projects with extensions
• Building Projects: [HTML5] Global-scope macros which call in-built variables will cause a build error
• Building Projects: [Mac IDE] Building archives for iOS and tvOS will not show Xcode Organiser on completion
• Building Projects: [Mac IDE] HTML5 and Android targets do not open Finder when the build has succeeded
• Building Projects: [Ubuntu IDE] Android, HTML5, and Ubuntu builds don't open the file browser to show the resulting package
• Building Projects: [Ubuntu IDE] Ubuntu builds fail when targeting the local machine
• Building Projects: [Ubuntu] Unable to build if targeting a 22.04 LTS machine, due to "Permission denied (publickey)"
• Building Projects: [Windows] Builds can fail if Windows is set to some language/region format styles, giving "startIndex cannot be larger than length of string" error
• Building Projects: Game Options > Windows values are not passed into NSIS builds, so .exes don't show copyright, etc. correctly in Windows dialogs
• Building Projects: [Xbox GDK] Add new Preference for whether to deploy the package after a Create Exe
• Building Projects: [YYC] Build fails when using parent constructor and new constructor as argument
• Building Projects: [tvOS] "Persistent Storage" dialog will continue to fill your ui.log with silent errors until GM is closed
• Code Editor: GM unstable when typing a dot after the square brackets of an array
• Code Editor: Tab name only uses lower case letters
• Debugger: GM hangs when debugging Toasty (and other projects which work with the new "ref" type in 2022.6)
• Debugger: GM hangs when debugging instance_create_layer() due to new "ref" type in 2022.6
• Debugger: GM unstable when passing "id" as parameter to function and putting a breakpoint inside the function
• Debugger: Originating code is not shown when hitting a breakpoint located on a line which has } at the end
• Debugger: Possible to not have the debugger re-enable the play button when hitting a breakpoint
• Device Manager: "Detect Device" for iOS and tvOS do not fill in the device details in Aug22
• Device Manager: [Mac IDE] "Launch Simulator" for iOS and tvOS launches the last simulator used
• Feather: "delete" is not flagging GM1052 on constructor functions created by "new", leading to unexpected in-game error
• Feather: "id" in-built variable is treated as read-only when assigned-to inside structs (e.g. "self.id = 1;")
• Feather: "with" loops cannot recognise arbitrary expressions
• Feather: Add a new "Unconstrained" style to each type on the Naming Rules screen
• Feather: Add filters and column-sorting into the Messages window
• Feather: Autocomplete sometimes does not show all matching results, gives fewer matches than the old version does
• Feather: Autocompletion window disappears when typing long identifiers near the end of a file
• Feather: Function tooltips do not support any multi-line content which is defined in the JSDoc
• Feather: GM crashes when showing tooltip or auto-complete for expressions which contain recursive macros
• Feather: GM2043 is never raised if an out-of-scope local variable is assigned to a new declaration of the same name
• Feather: Helper popups should never cover the line of code the caret is on
• Feather: If JSDoc sets "@returns Any" that function's "return" command always shows a warning about its type not being correct
• Feather: Immediate dot-access on struct literals raise an unexpected GM1012 error on valid code
• Feather: Implement improvements to "union" type support
• Feather: Macros incorrectly marked as recursive in some cases, shows unexpected GM1100
• Feather: Macros with Configs do not rewrite correctly
• Feather: Multiple issues with interpreting arrays or structs created from passing an array into "new"
• Feather: Output log fills up with "Unable find function 'ent_player_Event_Create$$anon_function ...', which should exist!", slowing the IDE
• Feather: Parameters only keep their type as "Any" until one with a default value is used, should always follow their JSDoc values and warn when mismatch detected
• Feather: Prefix operators following a semicolon are incorrectly parsed as ";++"
• Feather: Quick Fix to generate JSDoc mangles documentation in various ways
• Feather: Quick Fixes do not appear inside of function bodies
• Feather: Reassigning a macro to be an anonymous function created by "new" results in type-inference breaking
• Feather: Rendering tooltips of enums with too many members does not fit into the IDE window
• Feather: Repeated "unable to find function" messages shown in output after declaring a method variable
• Feather: Unexpected "Error Rewriting" for GM2001 when nested parentheses are used
• Feather: Suggestion GM2061 is raised even if the condition has an else branch
• Feather: Syntax highlighting for tooltips isn't correct
• Feather: Tooltips do not display for dereferenced variables of type 'Any'
• Feather: Tooltips do not display in deeply nested functions
• Feather: Tooltips for global variables should display the "global." prefix
• Feather: Type of arg[0]() is incorrectly inferred as Function instead of Array(Function)
• Feather: Type of argument[i] is incorrectly determined
• Feather: Unmatched curly braces do not raise an error
• Feather: layer_enable_fx() second argument is treated as "undefined", so gives unexpected warnings
• Feather: sprite_index and mask_index are treated as not allowing -1 as a valid assignment
• File Watcher: [Mac IDE] Should ignore any .DS_Store files which appear in the save location on disk, rather than adding them into the project .yyp
• Game Options: [Opera GX] Deleted games still show in your Game List
• GXC Integration: Game uploads fail if the Game Options "Game Name" value contains an underscore (and some other special characters)
• Inspector: [Animation Curve] Unable to paste a copied curve
• Inspector: [Font] Turns blank after regenerating a font texture when all glyphs are selected
• Localisation: Redefine Keys' "Delete" entry is not localised for Japanese
• Localisation: References to "Drag and Drop" (rather than "GML Visual") can still be found in some strings
• Localisation: Update IDE translations to account for changes in 2022.6
• Marketplace Integration: [Light skin] Asset Import dialog text turns invisible when an item is selected
• Object Editor: [Light skin] Sprite previews are just a black square
• Preferences: General's "IDE Font" label is not translated, is always English
• Preferences: JetBrains font uses a replacement font for Chinese glyphs, but the other font is not refreshed when JetBrains selected, gives missing characters inside GM
• Preferences: [Ubuntu IDE] Android SDK/NDK/JDK fields do not accept paths chosen in picker, require editing via keyboard
• Project Import: [Mac IDE] 2022.6 cannot import GM 2.2.5-and-older projects
• Project Load: [Mac IDE] Cannot open projects direct from Finder via their .yyp file / Project Load: [Mac IDE] Right-clicking .yyp files and "open with" shows Start Page, not the Import dialog
• Room Editor: GM crashes (on certain monitors) when opening room creation code if the currently-selected layer is a filter layer
• Room Editor: GM crashes when scrolling enough that the room goes off-screen whilst a filter layer is being previewed
• Room Editor: Rename filter layer "Rgb1/2/3" parameters to specify which one of R, G or B that setting actually affects
• Room Editor: Windblown Particle Effect settings are not localised, always use English
• Room Editor: Filter settings for "Boxes" and "Stripes Background" have same setting, but use different labels and range for it
• UI/UX: [Mac IDE] Laptop status is always set to false, so Macbooks do not use the expected hotkeys in some cases
• UI/UX: [Mac IDE] Touchpad scrolling no longer uses the OS's "inertia" value
• UI/UX: [Ubuntu IDE] Update libGTK 2 linkage to use libGTK 3 instead
• Workspaces: [Vulkan] Performance drops after dragging a workspace out to be a new child window multiple times whilst a room is opened
Changes Since Beta IDE 191
More Fixes/Performance Changes For Feather
<ul>
• Feather now does its parsing work on a separate application thread, so projects will load more quickly and should no longer cause "stalls"/"freezes" as you edit your projects
• Fixed a number of threading errors/crashes by making the change above
• You should also now find documents are fully code-coloured much more quickly after opening
Misc Important Changes To Be Aware Of
<ul>
• Room Editor: Fixed that duplicating a layer did not preserve all of its instance's creation code on the new layer you made and so you had to copy the code manually later

• Fixed some memory management around loading assets, will stop potential leaks and also fixes an issue with breakpoints failing to stay on the correct line in Object events if you later add other lines higher up in your code
Other Bugs Fixed
<ul>
• Building Projects: [Android] 800 Betas are frequently unable to clean the project cache because path names are > 260 chars [previously it said that a number of "jar_..." folders were locked]
• Device Manager: [Switch] "Test Connection" for a blank device always shows as successful [also did not detect EDEV devices because they are USB only - these will now be found properly]

• Game Options: [PS5] Removed redundant options which are not actually used during builds (for the most part because they now come from your game metadata anyway) - Version number, Package ID, NPTitleID, NPTitleSecret, Share Param File, Pronunciation File, and Pronunciation Sig
• Inspector: Sound waveform/preview pane is missing in 800 Betas
• Timeline Editor: Duplicated moments are not being parsed after they are created
• UI/UX: Tab and Shift+Tab no longer move between dialog fields in 800 Betas
Beta IDE 191
Added Opera GX Game Options SSO Account Label
<ul>

• In previous releases there was no indication/error given if a game registration failed because you were actually logged-in as a different SSO account in your browser to the one you had logged-into GM with

• Now, Game Options tells you which account GameMaker will use to register/upload your games to (or if you're not actually logged-in yet), so you can more easily see when there is an upload fail due to a simple account mismatch
• Note: if you do happen to use multiple Opera accounts, then you should continue to make sure your web browser is signed-in to the one you need before doing any uploads
Misc Important Changes To Be Aware Of
<ul>

• Added support for Android's "ProGuard" minifying and shrinking options - you can now enable these in Game Options if you wish (defaults to off) and the corresponding steps will then be performed during your builds
• Also added $YYAndroidProguard as a tag so that your extensions can inject into the proguard.pro file

• Included Files: GM crashes after adding multiple files at once to Datafiles directory [note that the fix for this one means empty folders wil no longer be shown in the Included Files editor window, but they are still on disk just fine]
Other Bugs Fixed
<ul>
• Asset Browser: GM crashes when duplicating a sprite in some 800 Betas
• Asset Browser: GM crash when deleting a corrupted sequence/sprite created in 800 Betas
• Building Projects: [YYC] Builds fail if struct member names are strings containing spaces
• Building Projects: [macOS] Fixed an issue where some special characters (such as apostrophes and brackets) were not escaped properly and so caused builds to fail
• Building Projects: [HTML5] index.html is included twice in package if a custom .html is selected in Game Options

• Building Projects: "Stripes Background" filter type will draw parts of other sprites in-game if the one chosen has not been set as on its own texture page [this actually is the same recommendation for several filter types, so now the IDE will warn you if your chosen sprite has not been marked as being on a textuire page by itself]
• Code Editor: Rollback variables "player_id" and "player_local" are not coloured as built-in variables
• Code Editor: network_send_raw(), skeleton_animation_set() and skeleton_animation_set_ext() all now correctly have their final argument marked as optional in autocomplete
• Code Editor (Visual): Typing "x" and "y" in instance creation code editors will also modify its Flip X/Y values in the room

• Note that there were actual several ways in which Room Editor commands could be accidentally triggered when typing in GML Visual editors which were open over the top of the room, and the fix above should resolve all of them
• Feather: gamepad_get_device_count() description needs to show more content from the manual in order to be useful
• Feather: http_request() is not treated as if it accepts Id.Buffer or Real types, gives unexpected Error GM1041 messages
• Feather: instance_activate_object() is not treated as allowing Id.Instance types, gives unexpected Warning GM1044 messages
• Feather: network_destroy() is not treated as accepting Id.Socket types, always gives unexpected Error GM1041 messages
• Feather: "player_id" and all other rollback multiplayer variable always cause unexpected Error GM1013 messages
• Feather: script_exists() causes unexpected Warning GM1029 messages
• GXC Integration: GM silently fails to register a new game on gx.games if browser account differs from IDE account [see the Game Options mention higher up]
• Project Save: Sprites made in 800 Betas can lose their content after reopening the project
• Project Save: Serializing of an object which has a collision event with itself causes an exception when saving
• Redefine Keys: "Show code snippets" no longer has an entry in the list
• Room Editor: GM unstable when attempting to paste an instance into the room in some 800 Betas / Room Editor: Copy-and-pasting assets results in an empty asset in some 800 Betas
• Sequence Editor: Removed a redundant "Asset Track" variable from sequence instances
• Sequence Editor: Unable to convert a parameter track to be a curve in 800 Betas
• UI/UX: [Mac IDE] Dock icon "Quit" option doesn't actually close GM
Beta IDE 187
Resource Refactor
<ul>
• This beta introduces a big clean-up to how assets are handled, which should have very minor impact on your usage just now but will make future releases far more stable
• There may be minor changes to the file format of some resources, sol please be aware of this if you're committed to source control and seeing some unexpected changes
New "Modes" For Feather
<ul>
• Added a new Preference for Relaxed Type vs Strict Type Checking

• Also added a new Preference for controlling the amount of warnings Feather wil show you in the code editor. You can now select between varying levels in the dropdown, which progressively enable more of the current warnings: "None" (which is compile errors only), "Syntax Errors" (which is syntax errors and compile errors),"Type Errors" (which adds variable type enforcement warnings), and "All" (everything Feather offers)
Misc Important Changes To Be Aware Of
<ul>

• Case-Insensitve file names are back - please be aware of this if you are moving projects between OS installs which use different naming conventions (or when committing into Git source-control repos)
Other Bugs Fixed
<ul>
• Crash Reporter: Fixed an issue in the last Beta where if a crash needed to be uploaded, then this caused the startup commands to be wrong when GM was restarted
• Debugger: [Mac IDE] Fixed the window jumping about when resetting to a maximised state
• Extension Editor: Extension Options section now has a "Reset To Default" button
• Feather: GM1059 being raised against a function declaration line blocks parsing of that function's body
• Feather: Anonymous functions declared in another function's parameter initialisation are not found later, gives unexpected "Unable to find function"
• Feather: Macro errors GM1038 and GM1051 are not always shown when the project's code should cause them to be
• Inspector: Added a highlight for the selected instance when using the Room Editor, so you can easily see which instance you're inspecting
• Project Load: Object Editor and Inspector can show same child listed twice in child list when reloading the project [might have seen this in the previous Beta]
• Room Editor: [SP] Untranslated description of path layer shown in status bar
• UI/UX: Platform selector gadget needs the legacy targets Xbox (XDK) and UWP to be removed
